name: Ffynnon

reviews.text: Staying here was a pleasure, if I was ever in the area again I would jump at the chance of staying here again. We stayed in Emily room, which has the most amazing bathroom and fantastic views over the lovely countryside of Wales. The service is amazing with little touches like the honesty bar.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Steve was so friendly and welcoming from the very start, the unique sense of total indulgence with a personal touch proved to create the most rewarding break we have taken in years.
reviews.title: Personal Luxury

reviews.text: The suite was incredible and worth every penny, the decor, sculptures and little touches finished Ffynnon tastefully to a very high stndard without being oppresive.
reviews.title: We felt that we were abroad - standards were so high

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spotlessly clean, quiet and relaxing. The food was beautifully prepared delicious and plentiful
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were emensely helpful, polite and considerate throughout; loans of maps, DVD's personal knowledge snippets and menu's for all local restaurants.
reviews.title: luxury boutique B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a frought and perilous drive through the Welsh countryside we arrived at Ffynnon to a warm welcome and a cosy room.
reviews.title: A fantastic weekend

reviews.text: Our room (Aimee) was luxurious and perfect, with gorgeous views over the hills, once the morning fog had cleared.
reviews.title: Relaxed holiday with toddler in tow? It can happen...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautifully decorated and the honesty bar a welcome treat (and very reasonably priced).
reviews.title: Absolute gem!

reviews.text: We will definately be recommending Ffynnon to our friends and would love to stay again.
reviews.title: Perfect little break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and one year old son stayed at Ffynnon for a week in Oct - choosing the new Hazel suite giving us a separate bed/playroom for our toddler. The room was beautifully and tastefully appointed, as was the rest of the impressive building and we enjoyed a luxurious stay. Despite 'boutique' standards, the warm and genuine hospitality extended to us by Steve and Debra, and their staff, made us feel welcome and relaxed immediately - our toddler being treated as an equally important guest.
reviews.title: A perfectly luxurious hideaway

reviews.text: We're just back from a wonderful stay at Ffynnon. Beautiful house, our rooms were Annis and Aimee, both lovely - very comfortable beds. Excellent service - Steve and Debra are great hosts. Very good breakfasts, especially the laverbread cakes! Lots of nice little touches, such as the tea & delicious welsh cakes on arrival, the fresh milk in the butler's pantry and honesty bar. Hopefully we can come and stay again sometime and maybe the rain will hold off next time (the Porthmadog to Blaenau railway is a great way to spend a rainy day!).
reviews.title: Lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a couple of years ago now and we are due another visit to this exquisite boutique B&B. This is simply luxury at its best and of all the places we've ever stayed in I have to say that so far this is just the best from the moment you arrive to your whole time staying here you are made to feel like you are the most important person. Breakfast was wonderful and so was the room that we stayed in. Steve and Debra certainly know how to look after their guests and nothing is too much for them. Eating out in Dolgellau Steve never recommended a bad place to eat and sorting out activities as well was made easy by Steve's choices. I can't rate this place high enough.
reviews.title: Just the best place we've ever stayed.

reviews.text: What a brilliant place! Steve and Debra were very welcoming, the decor and furnishings were luxurious and tasteful and the room itself was fab, with great views. Breakfast was very enjoyable and we received all round great service. I have recommended ffynon to friends and really hope to return one day, perhaps without the kids! Many thanks
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.text: I have travelled extensively & enjoyed staying in some of the world's best and Ffynnon is right up there. The decor & art are a joy, the ambiance warm & welcoming, the service outstanding - the whole experience was a sheer delight. We stayed for 5 nights and were sad to leave. I can only encourage you to experience it for yourself - you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Elegance & warmth, quality & care, exceptional & welcoming...
Would definitely go back
reviews.text: We stayed in the Sydney room for 1 night and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The bed was very comfortable so slept well and the shower was powerful and hot. The B&B is in an old rectory that has been beautifully decorated & furnished. On the ground floor there is a lounge with hewspapers & games and a lovely breakfast room. On the first floor there is a butlers pantry (next to Sydney room) where there is a fridge containing fresh milk, a wider selection of tea/coffee and where you can eat a takeaway if so desired. For breakfast there is fresh fruit, cereal & juice selection and lovely brown toast. The hot breakfast was a choice of pancakes, potato cakes, porridge as well non + vegetarian full Welsh. How refreshing to have alternative cooked choices than just the full English/Welsh so this was a definite positive for us! We have marked this as a 4 rather than a 5 for 3 reasons only: 1. it wasn't possible to just wash your hair without taking a shower as there was no hand held attachment to the bath or shower (and we had a quick turnaround to go out for a meal) 2. we found the bedroom to be slightly on the chilly side late evening (note, the welcome booklet does say that the temperature is set depending on the season but if you speak with the owners it is possible to over ride the standard setting but as we were only there for 1 night we didn't have chance to do this). 3. there is a lack of space/shelving in the bathroom to put toiletry bag/toiletries. However in light of the beautiful building, lovely rooms, nice welcome, good breakfast these are minor quibbles and we would recommend this B&B without hesitation and would happily return.

Beautifully restored house with well integrated modern touches. Relaxing atmosphere and beautiful location. Spotlessly clean. Excellent breakfast- will definitely try to get back here. Little more needs to be said - well worth considering if within your chosen location and budget.
reviews.title: Stunning house and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Ffynnon was an absolute delight. We arrived here after a very wet and windy cycle ride from Porthmadog and Debra could not have been more welcoming and nothing was too much trouble getting ourselves dried out. The hotel is just beautifully furnished and very comfortable throughout. Our room, Annis, was spacious with top notch bed linen and the sorts of little touches here and there that make a place stand out. I loved the way that they made the roll-top bath double as a shower - I'm not a fan of shower curtains normally, but even this really worked. Tea and welsh cakes in the sitting room was a great way to unwind and the butler's pantry functioned as a good dining room for our takeaway curry! An excellent night's sleep almost goes without saying and the cooked breakfast did not disappoint. We also took a packed lunch away with us for the next day's cycling and it was delicious. I would make a trip back to Snowdonia just to stay here. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Worth a trip to Dolgellau just to stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First rate weekend. Rooms were spacious and airy with good deocor. Debra the owner was very friendly and heplful. The breakfast was sumptious and there is a lovely restaurant just down the road Y Sospan.for evening meals. I prefer a hard mattress but the one in the room was quite soft - hence the three stars for sleep quality - not the hotels fault though. Staff were also very frienly. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: beautiful house - Lovely staff

reviews.text: We had a fantastic experience at Ffynnon. We stayed for one night in the Annis room with our toddler daughter. Steve was very accomodating on arrival and made us feel very welcome. The interior is stunning and we made good use of the butler kitchen where we enjoyed a delicious indian takeaway from the Indian restaurant a few minutes walk away. Breakfast was in keeping with the high standard we enjoyed throughout the stay. We only wish we had longer. This accomodation is on par with any high starred hotel we have stayed in. Very well done Steve and Debra. Keep up the good work. We hope to return, maybe without the toddler so that we can enjoy it even more as there was so much we didnt get to try..the hot tub...relaxing in the stunning lounge :0) We would reccommend this Gem very highly and are delighted to have discovered it.
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Ffynnnon. The place was very clean, very well presented with excellent attention to detail, and the beds were very comfortable. We stayed in the Annis room which had a lovely view over the gardens and hills. The hosts were superb making us feel very welcome. We would highly recommend it as a great place to stay and are already planning our next trip!
reviews.title: N&G

description: At Ffynnon, we give you a special place to unwind and relax in complete comfort. Situated in Southern Snowdonia, we offer sumptuous accommodation from which to explore or enjoy time with family or friends. Whether you choose to curl up with a good book from the library, enjoy afternoon tea or a glass of something stronger from our honesty bar or relax in your luxurious room – an indulgent mix of the classic and contemporary awaits.
